name: Guess the Game Show Online Quiz | TV Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Hosted by Bob Eubanks, this game show involved married couples coming on the show and answering intimate, and often embarrassing questions, about their married life, all so they could win a refrigerator. Which show was it?
questions.explanation:
The Newlywed Game.

	Studies have shown that sixty percent of the couples that appeared on "The Newlywed Game" were later divorced.

questions.text: Contestants on this game show hosted by Chuck Woolery must choose, out of three people, someone to go out on a date with. The next day, they report back to the show, and give a recap of their date. Which show is it?
questions.explanation:
Love Connection.

	Before "Joe Millionaire" and "The Bachelor", there was "Love Connection." This show was made in the late 80's and early 90's.

questions.text: On this game show, hosted by Kennedy, players must pick partners and work together to build up a "trust fund" of money by answering trivia questions. Then they've got to decide whether or not they want to share the money they've earned. Which show is it?
questions.explanation:
Friend or Foe.

	At the end of the game, the two remaining contestants must vote secretly on whether they think their partner is their friend, or their foe. If both contestants vote "friend", they split the money 50-50. If one votes "friend", and the other votes "foe", the person who voted "foe" gets all the money, and "friend" leaves empty-handed. If both vote "foe", neither of them get the money.

questions.text: On this GSN original, there are two sets of partners. The night before the show, each pair is given all the materials that they will need to know for the show. They have to learn all this stuff in twenty-four hours, which means they appear on the show with no sleep. Which show is it?
questions.explanation:
Cram.

	When the pairs aren't answering questions, they have to walk on giant hamster wheels. The goal of the game seems to be to make the contestants as tired as possible. They have to answer dumb riddles correctly, talk for sixty seconds on a given subject without stammering or saying "um" or "uh", and other difficult, exhausting things.

questions.text: On this game show, hosted by Todd Newton, the players have to win prizes by answering questions and avoiding a certain red cartoon character, who will take away all their money. What show is it?
questions.explanation:
Whammy & Whammy!.

	The original version, "Press Your Luck" of this show was aired in the 80s. Now, on the modern version, players can win all kinds of awesome prizes, like an MP3 player, a Suzuki car, or even a year's supply of M&M's!

questions.text: On this game show, hosted by Mark L. Walberg, contestants have to stand on circles on the stage. If someone answers a question incorrectly, his or her circle might open up and drop them underneath stage, eliminating them from the game. Which show is it?
questions.explanation:
Russian Roulette.

	Contestants can win up to a hundred thousand dollars, but first they have to correctly answer six questions in sixty seconds. If they get even one incorrect, or run out of time, they get dropped--literally!

questions.text: On this game show, there are eight contestants. They have to answer questions and bank money. If they get a chain of eight questions correct, they get $125,000. Each round, the players have to vote the weakest player off, until there are only two players left. Which game show is it?
questions.explanation:
Weakest Link.

	Hosted by the nasty Anne Robinson, this show was hugely popular for a while, but they don't make new Anne Robinson episodes anymore.

questions.text: In order to win a million dollars, players had to correctly answer fifteen questions, if they made it past the "fastest finger" round. It was hosted by talk show host Regis Philbin--which show is it?
questions.correct: Who Wants to be a Millionaire?
options: Maybe I Will, Maybe I Won't
questions.explanation:
Who Wants to be a Millionaire?.

	There were only a privileged few that won a million dollars. Celebrity Rosie O'Donnell almost won a million, but the million dollar question had her stumped, so she walked away with five hundred thousand for charity.

questions.text: Hosted by Richard Dawson, this game show involved families who had to try to give the most popular answers to survey questions. Which show was it?
questions.explanation:
Family Feud.

	Richard Dawson was also on "Hogan's Heroes", and appeared regularly on "Match Game". As any "Family Feud" fan knows, Dawson kissed every female contestant before she answered her first question.

questions.text: On this star-studded game show, players had to complete a sentence, and try to match the answers of six celebrities. Which show was it?
questions.explanation:
Match Game.

	Several different celebrities appeared on this show. Brett Sommers and Charles Nelson Reilly were regulars, and Richard Dawson appeared quite often, too. In "Match Game 90's", Brad Garrett, co-star of "Everybody Loves Raymond" appeared regularly. Thanks for playing my quiz, and please rate it! ;)
